metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13797 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The macaddress module before 0.2.9 for Node.js is prone to an arbitrarycommand injection flaw, due to allowing unsanitized input to an exec(rather than execFile) call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-macaddress - 0.2.9-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: node-macaddress package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.9-1').
